result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan D Lorvig in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Jonathan D Lorvig in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF288 and 14CF327 called.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

14CF288 - State moves to amend to misdemeanor theft 943.20 as PTAC - Granted - Guilty plea entered

14CF327 - DRI

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 1 year Probation - Must report to Probation by close of business on Friday, December 5, 2014
Must participate in restorative justice programs - Defendant and/or Department of Corrections must contact restorative justice within 30 days
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Must undergo any mental health evaluation and comply with recommended treatment and/or prescribed medications
Court costs
1 day jail credit if Probation is revoked
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence

Defendant Jonathan D Lorvig in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Jonathan D Lorvig in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:02  Court relates.
11:02  State relates and gives appearances.
11:03  Officer Ray Parr called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
11:07  Cross by Atty. Raymond.
11:11  Court questions witness.
11:12  State asks that Court take judicial notice of bail bond in Barron Co case #14CF288.  Court takes judicial notice.
11:12  State moves for finding of probable cause, and bindover.
11:13  Atty. Raymond makes argument.
11:15  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.
11:17  Information filed.
NG plea entered.
Bond to continue.




  Plea hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

THIS BOND IS AMENDED FROM A $100 CASH BOND TO A $500 CASH BOND WITH THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS.  
(this cash bond is in addition to any amounts that may have previously been posted)

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.

No contact with Jennifer L. or her residence.

State moves to quash warrant.  Court grants motion.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.
